column74:
It was summer afternoon, Jim ran out the station . The 4:30 train was about to leave. As he ran along the platform he saw a girl just ahead of him. She was young, about his age. He followed her into a carriage and sat down opposite her. She took out a magazine and was reading it. He took out a book and pretend to do the same. After a minute he looked up and smiled at her. She did not smile back but gave him and encouraging look. Both returned to their reading but this time she was pretending too.
He found her attractive and wanted to see her again , but how to arrange it?---He had an idea. He took an old envelope out of his pocket and wrote the following words, Hello! My  number is 123-4567 and my name is Jim. I would very much like to see you again. Ring me at nine.
The  train arrived at the terminal. Without looking at the girl , he handed her the envelope, or rather threw at her, and jumped off the train.
When he got home he made himself a cup of coffee and wondered ---- perhaps she was one of those naturally friendly people who smile at everybody. He was listening to the radio when the telephone rang ----it was only Umaru, Nine o clock arrive, then 9:30 - and no telephone call from the girl. Felling miserable he went to bed early.
It was foggy morning Hallo, is that Jim? This is Joan. You-----it was two minutes past nine.
Question:  On the train Jim was

When he got home he made himself a cup of coffee and wondered ---- perhaps she was one of those naturally friendly people who smile at everybody. He was listening to the radio when the telephone rang ----it was only Umaru, Nine o clock arrive, then 9:30 - and no telephone call from the girl. Felling miserable he went to bed early.
It was foggy morning Hallo, is that Jim? This is Joan. You-----it was two minutes past nine.
Question: That evening he had a telephone call
column97: the girl he met on the train
column102:
utme/84 passage 1 It was summer afternoon, Jim ran out the station . The 4:30 train was about to leave. As he ran along the platform he saw a girl just ahead of him. She was young, about his age. He followed her into a carriage and sat down opposite her. She took out a magazine and was reading it. He took out a book and pretend to do the same. After a minute he looked up and smiled at her. She did not smile back but gave him and encouraging look. Both returned to their reading but this time she was pretending too.
He found her attractive and wanted to see her again , but how to arrange it?---He had an idea. He took an old envelope out of his pocket and wrote the following words, Hello! My  number is 123-4567 and my name is Jim. I would very much like to see you again. Ring me at nine.
The  train arrived at the terminal. Without looking at the girl , he handed her the envelope, or rather threw at her, and jumped off the train.
When he got home he made himself a cup of coffee and wondered ---- perhaps she was one of those naturally friendly people who smile at everybody. He was listening to the radio when the telephone rang ----it was only Umaru, Nine o clock arrive, then 9:30 - and no telephone call from the girl. Felling miserable he went to bed early.
It was foggy morning Hallo, is that Jim? This is Joan. You-----it was two minutes past nine.
Question: This source of misunderstanding was
column104: the station clock being out of order
column105: the time given by Jim - 9 o clock
